maml:description.maml:para: Get the properties of an Azure Site Recovery Fabric.
The Get-AzureRmSiteRecoveryFabric cmdlet gets the properties of a specified Azure Site Recovery Fabric or all Azure Site Recovery Fabrics in a Recovery Service vault.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the operation information for the current Site Recovery vault.
The Get-AzureRmSiteRecoveryJob cmdlet gets Azure Site Recovery jobs. You can use this cmdlet to view the operation information for the current Site Recovery vault.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the start time for the jobs. This cmdlet gets all jobs that started after the specified time.

Specifies the end time for the jobs. This cmdlet gets all jobs that started before the specified time. To obtain a DateTime object for this parameter, use the Get-Date cmdlet. For more information, type `Get-Help Get-Date`.
Specifies the ID of the object targeted by the job.
Specifies the input state for a Site Recovery job. This cmdlet gets all jobs that match the specified state. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- NotStarted
- InProgress
- Succeeded
- Other
- Failed
- Cancelled
- Suspended
Specifies a unique name that identifies the job.
Specifies the Site Recovery job.
Specifies the start time for the jobs. This cmdlet gets all jobs that started after the specified time.

Specifies the end time for the jobs. This cmdlet gets all jobs that started before the specified time. To obtain a DateTime object for this parameter, use the Get-Date cmdlet. For more information, type `Get-Help Get-Date`.
Specifies the ID of the object targeted by the job.
Specifies the input state for a Site Recovery job. This cmdlet gets all jobs that match the specified state. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- NotStarted
- InProgress
- Succeeded
- Other
- Failed
- Cancelled
- Suspended
Specifies a unique name that identifies the job.
Specifies the Site Recovery job.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets protection containers for the current Site Recovery vault.

The Get-AzureRmSiteRecoveryProtectionContainer cmdlet gets protection containers for the current Azure Site Recovery vault. A protection container is a logical container for protected objects such as virtual machines. Protection policies define replication settings for protected items and can be associated with a protection container and applied to a protected entity.

maml:Description.maml:para: A string specifying the name of the protection container.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a Site Recovery replication policy.

The New-AzureRmSiteRecoveryPolicy cmdlet creates an Azure Site Recovery replication policy. The replication policy is used to specify replication settings such as the replication frequency and number of recovery points.

maml:Description.maml:para: A string specifying a friendly name which identifies the Site Recovery replication policy.
A string specifying the replication provider. Valid values are:
- HyperVReplica2012R2
- HyperVReplica2012
- HyperVReplicaAzure
A string specifying the replication frequency interval in seconds. Valid values are:
An integer specifying the number of hours to retain recovery points.
An integer specifying the frequency of the application consistent snapshot in hours.
An instance of a TimeeSpan object specifying the replication start time. It must be no later than 24-hours from the start of the job.
A string specifying the Azure storage account ID of the replication target.
A string specifying the EnterpriseToAzure parameter set.
A string specifying a friendly name which identifies the Site Recovery replication policy.
A string specifying the replication provider. Valid values are:
- HyperVReplica2012R2
- HyperVReplica2012
- HyperVReplicaAzure
A string specifying the replication frequency interval in seconds. Valid values are:
An integer specifying the number of hours to retain recovery points.
An integer specifying the frequency of the application consistent snapshot in hours.
An instance of a TimeeSpan object specifying the replication start time. It must be no later than 24-hours from the start of the job.
A string specifying the replication method. Valid values are:
- Online
- Offline
A string indicating whether compression should be enabled on the policy.
An integer specifying the port used for replication.
A string specifying the type of authentication used. Valid values are:
- Certificate
- Kerberos
A string indicating whether Replica should be Deleted on disabling protection of a protection entity protected by the Policy.
A string specifying a friendly name which identifies the Site Recovery replication policy.
A string specifying the replication provider. Valid values are:
- HyperVReplica2012R2
- HyperVReplica2012
- HyperVReplicaAzure
A string specifying the replication frequency interval in seconds. Valid values are:
An integer specifying the number of hours to retain recovery points.
An integer specifying the frequency of the application consistent snapshot in hours.
An instance of a TimeeSpan object specifying the replication start time. It must be no later than 24-hours from the start of the job.
A string specifying the Azure storage account ID of the replication target.
A string specifying the EnterpriseToAzure parameter set.
A string specifying the replication method. Valid values are:
- Online
- Offline
A string indicating whether compression should be enabled on the policy.
An integer specifying the port used for replication.
A string specifying the type of authentication used. Valid values are:
- Certificate
- Kerberos
A string indicating whether Replica should be Deleted on disabling protection of a protection entity protected by the Policy.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Remove a recovery plan
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$RecoveryPlan = Get-AzureRmSiteRecoveryRecoveryPlan PS C:\> Remove-AzureRmSiteRecoveryRecoveryPlan -RecoveryPlan $RecoveryPlan

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command uses the Get-AzureRmSiteRecoveryRecoveryPlan cmdlet to get the Site Recovery plan, and then stores it in the $RecoveryPlan variable.
The second command removes the recovery plan in $RecoveryPlan.

The Remove-AzureRmSiteRecoverySite cmdlet deletes an Azure Site Recovery site from the current vault.

The Remove-AzureRmSiteRecoveryStorageClassificationMapping cmdlet removes a storage classification mapping from Azure Site Recovery.

The Set-AzureRmSiteRecoveryProtectionEntity cmdlet enables or disables protection on an Azure Site Recovery protection entity.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets recovery properties such as target network and virtual machine size for a Replication Protected Item.
The Set-AzureRmSiteRecoveryReplicationProtectedItem cmdlet sets the recovery properties for a Replication Protected Item.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the Azure Site Recovery Replication Protected Item.
Specifies the name of the recovery virtual machine.
Specifies the recovery virtual machine size. The value should be from the set of sizes supported by Azure virtual machines.
Specifies the NIC of the virtual machine for which this cmdlet sets the recovery network property.
Specifies the ID of the Azure virtual network for which this cmdlet recovers the Protected Item.
Specifies the name of the Subnet on the recovery Azure virtual network for which this cmdlet recovers the Protected Item.
Specifies the static IP address that should be assigned to primary NIC on recovery.
Specifies the network interface card (NIC) properties set by user or set by default. You can specify NotSelected to go back to the default values.
Specifies the license type selection for Windows Server virtual machines migrated through Hybrid use benefit.

Specifies the license type selection for Windows Server virtual machines migrated through Hybrid use benefit.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the Site Recovery vault context for further operations.
The Set-AzureRmSiteRecoveryVaultSettings cmdlet sets the Azure Site Recovery vault context for further operations. This does not apply to recovery services vaults.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies an ASRVault object.
Specifies an ARSVault object.
Specifies an ASRVault object.
Specifies an ARSVault object.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the recovery-side options for a Site Recovery protection entity.

The Set-AzureRmSiteRecoveryVM cmdlet sets the recovery-side protection options, such as the recovery virtual machine size and recovery virtual machine network, for Azure Site Recovery protection entities.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the Site Recovery virtual machine object.
Specifies the name of the target virtual machine.
Specifies the target virtual machine size.
Specifies the primary network adapter card.
Specifies the recovery network ID.
Specifies the Azure virtual network subnet name with which to attach the primary network adapter controller on recovery.
Specifies the static IP address that is assigned to primary network adapter controller on recovery.
Specifies the network adapter selection properties. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- NotSelected
- SelectedByUser

- NotSelected
- SelectedByUser

maml:description.maml:para: Changes a recovery point for a failed over protected item before commiting the failover operation.
The Start-AzureRmSiteRecoveryApplyRecoveryPoint changes a recovery point for a failed over protected item before it commits the failover operation.

maml:Description.maml:para: An instance of an ASRRecoveryPoint object that this cmdlet will change.
An instance of an ASRReplicationProtectedItem object.
A string specifying the primary data encryption certificate.
A string specifying the secondary data encryption certificate.
An instance of an ASRRecoveryPoint object that this cmdlet will change.
An instance of an ASRReplicationProtectedItem object.
A string specifying the primary data encryption certificate.
A string specifying the secondary data encryption certificate.

maml:description.maml:para: Starts the commit failover action for a Site Recovery object.
The Start-AzureRmSiteRecoveryCommitFailoverJob cmdlet starts the commit failover process for an Azure Site Recovery object after a failover operation.

maml:Description.maml:para: An instance of an ASRReplicationProtectedItem object.
An instance of an ASRRecoveryPlan object.
An instance of an ASRProtectionEntity object.
An instance of an ASRReplicationProtectedItem object.
An instance of an ASRRecoveryPlan object.
An instance of an ASRProtectionEntity object.

maml:description.maml:para: Starts a Site Recovery planned failover operation.

The Start-AzureRmSiteRecoveryPlannedFailoverJob cmdlet starts a planned failover for an Azure Site Recovery protection entity or recovery plan. You can check whether the job succeeds by using the Get-AzureRmSiteRecoveryJob cmdlet.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the Site Recovery protection entity object.
Specifies the direction of the failover. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- PrimaryToRecovery
- RecoveryToPrimary
Specifies what to optimize for. This parameter applies when failover is done from an Azure site to an on-premise site which requires a substantial data synchronization. Valid values are:
- ForDowntime
- ForSynchronization

When ForDowntime is specified, this indicates that data is synchronized before failover to minimize downtime. Synchronization is performed without shutting down the virtual machine. After synchronization is complete, the job is suspended. Resume the job to do an additional synchronization operation that shuts down the virtual machine.

When ForSynchronization is specified, this indicates that data is synchronized during failover only so data synchronization is minimized. With this setting enabled, the virtual machine is shut down immediately. Synchronization starts after shutdown to complete the failover operation.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- Yes
- No
An instance of an ASRServer object.
Specifies the primary certificate file.
Specifies the secondary certificate file.
Specifies the direction of the failover. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- PrimaryToRecovery
- RecoveryToPrimary
Specifies what to optimize for. This parameter applies when failover is done from an Azure site to an on-premise site which requires a substantial data synchronization. Valid values are:
- ForDowntime
- ForSynchronization

When ForDowntime is specified, this indicates that data is synchronized before failover to minimize downtime. Synchronization is performed without shutting down the virtual machine. After synchronization is complete, the job is suspended. Resume the job to do an additional synchronization operation that shuts down the virtual machine.

When ForSynchronization is specified, this indicates that data is synchronized during failover only so data synchronization is minimized. With this setting enabled, the virtual machine is shut down immediately. Synchronization starts after shutdown to complete the failover operation.
The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- Yes
- No

When ForDowntime is specified, this indicates that data is synchronized before failover to minimize downtime. Synchronization is performed without shutting down the virtual machine. The acceptable values for this parameter are:

- No

maml:description.maml:para: Starts a Site Recovery replication policy association job.
The Start-AzureRmSiteRecoveryPolicyAssociationJob cmdlet initiates an association job to associate a replication policy with an Azure Site Recovery protection container.

Specifies a recovery protection container.

maml:description.maml:para: Stops a Site Recovery job.
The Stop-AzureRmSiteRecoveryJob cmdlet stops an Azure Site Recovery job.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the Site Recovery job object to stop.
Specifies the unique name for the Site Recovery job to stop.
Specifies the Site Recovery job object to stop.
Specifies the unique name for the Site Recovery job to stop.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates the Site Recovery Policy
The Update-AzureRmSiteRecoveryPolicy updates the Site Recovery policy specified by the Policy parameter. The policy parameters control the various configuration setting for Site Recovery.

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of the policy to update.
Specifies the replication frequency interval in seconds.
Specifies the number of hours to retain recovery points.
Specifies the frequency of the application consistent snapshot in hours.
Specifies the replication start time. It must be no later than 24-hours from the start of the job.
Specifies the Azure storage account ID of the replication target.
Specifies whether the policy is encrypted.
Specifies the replication method. Valid values are: - Online
- Offline
Specifies whether compression is enabled for the policy.
Specifies the port used for replication.
Specifies the type of authentication used. Valid values are: - Certificate
- Kerberos
Specifies whether the Replica should be deleted on disabling protection of an entity to which the policy applies.
The name of the policy to update.
Specifies the replication frequency interval in seconds.
Specifies the number of hours to retain recovery points.
Specifies the frequency of the application consistent snapshot in hours.
Specifies the replication start time. It must be no later than 24-hours from the start of the job.
Specifies the Azure storage account ID of the replication target.
Specifies whether the policy is encrypted.
Specifies the replication method. Valid values are: - Online
- Offline
Specifies whether compression is enabled for the policy.
Specifies the port used for replication.
Specifies the type of authentication used. Valid values are: - Certificate
- Kerberos
Specifies whether the Replica should be deleted on disabling protection of an entity to which the policy applies.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates the source and target server for the protection of a Site Recovery object.
The Update-AzureRmSiteRecoveryProtectionDirection cmdlet updates the source and target server for the protection of an Azure Site Recovery object after the completion of a commit failover operation.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the protection entity object.
Specifies the direction of the commit. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- PrimaryToRecovery
- RecoveryToPrimary
Specifies the direction of the commit. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- PrimaryToRecovery
- RecoveryToPrimary
Specifies a recovery plan object.
Specifies the direction of the commit. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- PrimaryToRecovery
- RecoveryToPrimary
The item to be protected.

Specifies the direction of the commit. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- PrimaryToRecovery
- RecoveryToPrimary

The item to be protected.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates a recovery plan in Site Recovery.
The Update-AzureRmSiteRecoveryRecoveryPlan cmdlet updates a recovery plan in Azure Site Recovery and then publishes it.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies a recovery plan that this cmdlet updates.
Specifies the path of the recovery plan file of the recovery plan that this cmdlet updates.
Specifies a recovery plan that this cmdlet updates.
Specifies the path of the recovery plan file of the recovery plan that this cmdlet updates.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command updates the specified recovery plan, and then publishes it.

maml:description.maml:para: Refreshes a Site Recovery server.
The Update-AzureRmSiteRecoveryServer cmdlet refreshes an Azure Site Recovery server.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the Site Recovery server that this cmdlet updates.
Specifies the Site Recovery server that this cmdlet updates.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates the information received from the Azure Site Recovery Services Provider.

The Update-AzureRmSiteRecoveryServicesProvider cmdlet updates the information received from the Azure Site Recovery Services Provider. You can use this cmdlet to trigger a refresh of the information received from the Recovery Services Provider.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the Azure Site Recovery Services Provider object.
Specifies the Azure Site Recovery Services Provider object.
